FastC Wrapper¶

Wraps the plot_vals() function to allow for more customization.

ising.fastcwrapper.plotvals(ham, length, temps[, boltzmann = BOLTZMANN_K, threads = max(32, 4 + os.cpu_count()), no_c = False])¶

This is a wrapper around ising.fastc.plot_vals() which converts iterables to lists, hamiltonians to their parameters, and adds default values for threads, the Boltzmann constant, and contains a flag for whether to actually use the C backend. It also handles whether the C backend is included.

Parameters

  • ham (ising.hamiltonian.PeriodicHamiltonian) – The hamiltonian. Currently only works on periodic boundary conditions.

  • length (int) – The number of positions in the Ising model.

  • temps (iterable) – The temperatures to plot for.

  • boltzmann (float) – The Boltzmann constant. Defaults to ising.constants.BOLTZMANN_K

  • threads (int) – The number of threads to use. Defaults to max(32, 4 + os.cpu_count()).

  • no_c (bool) – Whether or not to use the C backend. Defaults to False.
